Sentencas: Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-delta (SFMO) perovskite has been considered as a promising anode candidate for solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Optimized Solid-State Synthesis of Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-δ Perovskite: Implications for Efficient Synthesis of Mo-Containing SOFC Electrodes

Sentencas: However, the significant inconsistency in the conductivity properties of SFMO perovskite has been reported in the literature through various synthesis procedures, highlighting the necessity of a standard and unified synthesis process.
Titulo: Optimized Solid-State Synthesis of Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-δ Perovskite: Implications for Efficient Synthesis of Mo-Containing SOFC Electrodes

Sentencas: In this work, we propose an optimized solid-state synthesis process of SFMO perovskite based on the thermal properties of the precursors.
Titulo: Optimized Solid-State Synthesis of Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-δ Perovskite: Implications for Efficient Synthesis of Mo-Containing SOFC Electrodes

Sentencas: Our TG analysis indicates that the evaporation of MoO3 during sintering over 752 degrees C may affect the synthesis of the expected SFMO perovskite.
Titulo: Optimized Solid-State Synthesis of Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-δ Perovskite: Implications for Efficient Synthesis of Mo-Containing SOFC Electrodes

Sentencas: The presence of Fe2O3 has a trap effect on MoO3, based on the TG analysis of the binary mixture.
Titulo: Optimized Solid-State Synthesis of Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-δ Perovskite: Implications for Efficient Synthesis of Mo-Containing SOFC Electrodes

Sentencas: A cubically structured SFMO perovskite without a secondary phase is obtained from the as-proposed stepwise sintering program while an impurity phase of SrMoO4 is observed when adopting a direct sintering program.
Titulo: Optimized Solid-State Synthesis of Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-δ Perovskite: Implications for Efficient Synthesis of Mo-Containing SOFC Electrodes

Sentencas: The as-synthesized SFMO perovskite exhibits high stability in a reducing atmosphere, which is attributed to the self-adjustment of the overall valence states of molybdenum ions and iron ions.
Titulo: Optimized Solid-State Synthesis of Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-δ Perovskite: Implications for Efficient Synthesis of Mo-Containing SOFC Electrodes

Sentencas: Many pure cubically structured perovskites have been successfully synthesized using the as-proposed solid-state synthesis process, suggesting its universality for the synthesis of other Mo-containing SOFC perovskite electrodes.
Titulo: Optimized Solid-State Synthesis of Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-δ Perovskite: Implications for Efficient Synthesis of Mo-Containing SOFC Electrodes
